Kup/Darkhawk/Perceptor/hydras:

"No!!!!!"Yelled an angry Darkhawk before f=
ell in stasis, Kup managed to drag him away of the Predacons.

"We need to =
move out!!!"yelled Kup

Hydras Was very mad this time "DONT LET THEM RUN AW=
AY!!!!! PRIME WITH MY BARE HADNS I'LL RIP THE MATRIX and YOUR SPARK OUT YOU=
R BODY!!!" 

Perceptor continued Shooting agaisnt the MAximals



From: San=
dy 
Sent: Monday, April 12, 2010 10:31 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subje=
ct: Re: BlackFortress


  
OOC: Tucson collapsed due to extreme exhaustion =
and some moderate burn damages from the magma. Yes, even magma didn't stopp=
 him from trying to help his comrades. He's got some burn marks in his armo=
r, and that's his damaged state for now.

BIC: 

Perhaps the power he had e=
xtended outward, was in vain. Tucson lies on the ground for a moment or so,=
 but slowly rolls back up onto his left side, holding up his upper body wit=
h his arms which shake under the sheer pressure of his weight. He looks aro=
und, and finds Darkhawk, severely weakened by the powerful blast. Night Shi=
ft wastes no time in slapping a pair of stasis cuffs on Darkhawk, who in re=
ality was Windlord.

"Gotchya. Don't worry, you're in good hands now. Yo, K=
up! Better take this guy for me, I think Tucson Prime's commn' around."

Tu=
cson calmly looks around yet with a stern expression on his face.

"Not - t=
he result I was hoping for but - it did enable us to get somewhere. Can't -=
 have it all I suppose, but doesn't mean we're giving up all together."

Sl=
owly he makes it onto his knees, and then plants one foot down on the groun=
d, hoisting himself up to his feet, with a bit of a stumble. He was weak, e=
xtremely weak, and it was questionable wether or not he would be able to co=
ntinue fighting. He didn't want anyone to see him in such a condition thoug=
h. He fights his weakness and tries to shrug off the grogginess he feels. N=
ight Shift nodds in agreement with Tucson Prime. 

" I hear ya on that one =
big bot. Sometimes, ya win some, ya lose some, and sometimes it's kinda lik=
e in the middle of both losn' and winn'n."

Tucson understood that the miss=
ion itself would be difficult so he prepared himself for the unexpected by =
working with that uncertainty that plans don't always go as they are intend=
ed. He shrugs off the fact that Cyclonus is not even scathed by the energy =
attack. He was now curious about Rodimus and how he had handled it. 

" Som=
ething - Rodimus wasn't too good at doing. I have a feeling he may not have=
 taken this too well, Nightshift."

Nightshift narrows his optics.

" Lemme=
 tell ya somethn' Tucson, before you became a Prime, and he was on the job,=
 it didn't look like his spark was totally in his work. But you, the quiet =
guy in the corner, the guy who threw caution ta the wind ta save his comrad=
es, the guy who faces adversity as it comes and ain't afraid of it, and the=
 guy who actually learned from his loss rather than complain'n about it. Yo=
u got what it takes, and always had it. It - just wasn't obvious because yo=
u're too modest for your own good and you kinda just kept ta yourself most =
of the time."

Tucson listens thoughtfully to Nightshift.

" You're right, =
I wasn't much for words at the time... But back then, I wanted to approach =
Rodimus on his not so pleasurable attitude on his position as a Prime. It s=
eemed as if he didn't want it. And you know, responsibility isn't for every=
one. And for some, it's second nature."

Night Shift nodds.

" Understandab=
le. Now I admit, I dunno if I could ever take your job big guy. Not that I =
ain't capable of it, I know I ain't a good match for the position. And I ai=
n't afraid ta admit that."

Tucson Prime nodds once, and studies Cyclonus o=
nce more. Something dawns on him. He seemed relieved to be free of somethin=
g. 

"Is it me Cyclonus or do you appear to be liberated of something that =
may have been holding you back? Why do you work with Hydras anyway? What is=
 the purpose of working with him when you can be your own individual? Your =
life should be as you intended, and not what others have intended for you. =
It boils down to freedom. You have the chance to experience freedom. If I w=
ere you I'd take that chance now. As a matter of fact, Scorponok, Scourge, =
what seems to be holding you two back here, when you yourselves can be your=
 own individuals as Decepticons? Does Hydras have you on some sort of leash=
? I see no such restraints so that means if you want freedom you should als=
o take it."

Night Shift could see what Tucson was up to. It was one of his=
 thinking outside the box kind of strategies. And a strategy that would ben=
efit all and not just one faction. Tucson was trying to break new ground, a=
nd as crazy as it all looked, he sits back to watch it all take place. Tucs=
on Prime now steps asside and waits to see if any of them either try to des=
troy him, or actually agree with what he was trying to tell them.

"Whateve=
r any of you chose, your decision is your own and I will not interfere. We =
may not be allies, but I do respect the need for one's free will. But if yo=
u attack me, do not expect me to be so forgiving."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogrou=
ps.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > Nightlight Nodded,=
 she stood up with fear in her face. she was ready to follow Rodimus
> 
> R=
odimus tapped his code on the door and it slid open. He stepped out
> of th=
e chamber and looked around for a moment. He nodded, satisfied
> that there=
 were no intruders in the hall. He looked back at Nightlight
> and motioned=
 for her to follow.
> 
> With a grinding of gears he shifted into his vehic=
ular mode and opened his door.
> 
> "Come on." he said as he gunned his eng=
ine. "I will will protect you.
> We need to head towards the throne room. I=
f there is anywhere that is
> more protected in this place it is there."
> =

> He flipped on his lights and once Nightlight had gotten in he took
> off=
, burning rubber as he moved!
> 
> OOC: Remember, Rodimus and Nightlight sh=
ould be unaware of Tuscon's
> intrusion, so this since like a good way to b=
ring everyone together.
> Rodimus acting in ignorance :)
> 
> Preston
>
